content:
ly  powers  such  as  his  mom  and  his
teachers. A small child such as Calvin finds it easy to imagine that a box just
might be able to fly like an airplane (or something), because Calvin doesn’t
know how airplanes work.
A good example from the biological world of complex changes appearing
to be simple is the belief in spontaneous generation. One of the chief propo-
nents of the theory of spontaneous generation during the middle of the 19th
century was Ernst Haeckel, a great admirer of Darwin
